seriessubdivision control of ic  3674 in accordance with ic  3674405i the commission shall make decisions concerning development plans and amendments to development plans in accordance with the 1400 seriesdevelopment plans of ic  3674 street numbering and naming in accordance with ic  3674405b and c the commission shall 1 assign street numbers to lots and structures  2 renumber lots and structures  3 if provided by ordinance name or rename streets in the event that an ordinance does not provide the commission authority to name or rename streets the mayor of the city of whiting shall have such authority streets shall be named and renamed so that their names are easy to understand and to avoid duplication or conflict with other street names in the city of whiting street numbering and numbering notification in accordance with ic  3674405h if the commission or the mayor of the city of whiting names or renames streets or numbers or renumbers lots or structures under of this the commission or mayor shall notify 1 the circuit court clerk or board of registration  2 the administrator of the enhanced emergency telephone system established under ic  36816  3 the united states postal service  and 4 any person or body that the commission or mayor considers appropriate to receive notice notification of its action shall be no later than the last day of the month following the month in which such action is taken by the commission article ix  final disposition of recommendations and decisions final disposition in accordance with ic  3674405a1 the final disposition of such recommendations by the commission shall be in the form of a written recommendation to the whiting common council the written recommendation shall set forth the findings and determinations of the commission together with any modification specification or limitation which the recommendation takes case dismissal the commission may dismiss any petition or decision for lack of presentation or lack of jurisdiction if a petitioner fails to appear at two 2 consecutive regular meetings of the commission in which the petitioner is on the agenda to present his or her case to the commission the case may be dismissed by the commission for lack of presentation withdrawal of petition by the petitioner following the publication of notice for any public hearing until the conclusion of the hearing a petitioner may not withdraw the matter to come before the public hearing without approval of the commission petition after withdrawal a case which has been withdrawn by the petitioner shall not be again placed on the commission agenda for consideration for a period of twelve 12 months after the date of withdrawal by the petitioner as established by the approval of the commission petition resubmission a case which has been decided adversely to the petitioner shall not again be placed on the commission agenda for consideration until twelve 12 months after the date of the decision previously rendered by the commission article x  appropriations expenditures and grants appropriations in accordance with ic  3674308 after a legislative body has adopted an ordinance establishing a municipal plan commission  the fiscal body of the municipality in the commissions case the whiting common council may make appropriations to the commission to carry out the duties of the commission expendituresreversions in accordance with ic  3674309 the commission may expend in accord with applicable state county and municipal fiscal procedures all amounts appropriated to it for the purposes and activities authorized by ic  3674 any unexpended or unencumbered part of the commissions appropriated funds shall revert to the city general fund at the end of each fiscal year professional organizations or conferences in accordance with ic  3674222 if the commission determines that it is necessary or desirable for members or employees to join a professional organization or to attend a conference or interview dealing with planning or related problems the commission may pay the applicable membership fees and all actual expenses of the members or employees if that amount has been appropriated by the whiting common council gifts donations and grants in accordance with ic  3674310 a municipality may accept gifts donations and grants from private or governmental sources for advisory plan commission purposes or planning department purposes as may be the case any money so accepted shall be deposited with the municipality as may be the case in a special nonreverting plan commission fund to be available for expenditures by the commission for the purpose designed by the source the whiting clerktreasurer shall draw warrants against the special nonreverting fund only on vouchers signed by the president and the secretary of the commission in accordance with ic  3674409 a commission may within its approved budget negotiate for grantsinaid and agree to terms and conditions attached to them this section is specific authority to enter into grantsinaid agreements under 40 usc section 461 under the same limitations the commission may enter into grantsinaid agreements under act relating to planning and zoning article xi  public hearing petition filing process public hearing the commission shall hold hearings as are required by state statute and city ordinances the commission may hold additional hearings at such times and places upon notice as the commission considers necessary petition filing a petitioner who seeks to vacate a plat amend the zoning ordinance amend the subdivision control ordinance amend the comprehensive plan or other matter under the jurisdiction of the commission shall file a petition with the commission a minimum of ten 10 copies of the petition and application must be filed with the commission at least thirty 30 days prior to the next regularly scheduled commission meeting in order to be included on the meetings agenda filing fee authority in accordance with ic  3674411 the commission may establish a schedule of reasonable fees to defray the administrative costs connected with the following 1 processing and hearing administrative appeals and petitions for rezoning special exemptions special uses contingent uses and variances  2 issuing permits  and 3 other official actions taken under ic  3674 filing fees all petitions not initiated by the commission itself may be accomplished by a nonrefundable filing fee in an amount established by the commission the commission shall set such filing fees as necessary to defray the administrative costs associated with any petition in the event the commission establishes filing fees for petitions the fee schedule shall be documented under this section the filing fees shall be as follows for the whiting plan commission 1 comprehensive plan petition 1 text amendment  $2500 2 map amendment  $7500 2 zoning petition a text amendment  $2500 b map amendment  $7500 additional information the commission may require additional information data statistics or plats beyond those established by statute or ordinance which are deemed necessary for intelligent determination by the commission in the event of a public hearing the burden shall be upon the petitioner to supply all information including charts diagrams and other exhibits necessary for a clear understanding of the issue public hearing scheduling if the commission finds that a petition is in good order with sufficient information it shall set a time for a public hearing on the matter and shall provide public notice in accordance with ic  51415 public notice requirements notice of a public hearing as required by state statute or city ordinance shall contain at a minimum the following information 1 docket number and the substance of the matter to be heard  2 general location by address or other identifiable geographic characteristics of the property  3 name of the person agency or entity initiating the matter to be heard  4 time and place of the he hearing  5 statement that the petition may be examined at the commission office  6 statement that any person may offer verbal comments at the hearing or may file written comments prior to or at the hearing  and 7 any other information which may be required by law to be contained in such notice public notice of a hearing the petitioner shall prepare the legal advertisement of the public hearing for the approval of the commission the petitioner shall bear the expense of the public notices advertising costs in addition the commission shall at its discretion require the petitioner to notify by certified letter all persons deemed by state statute and the commission to be interested parties at least ten 10 days before the date of the public hearing at the public hearing the petitioner shall provide proof of publication that the petitioner has complied with this requirement interested parties the commission shall by rule determine who effected property owners are as interested parties the names of property owners to be notified by certified mail are to be ascertained from the real estate tax assessment list as they appear in the office of the north township assessor of lake county located at 232 russell street in hammond indiana 46320 2199332810 in order for the assessors office to prepare a list the petitioner must provide the assessors office with the legal description and address of the affected property allow adequate time the north township assessors office suggests thirty 30 days for the assessors office to prepare the list proof of public notice to affected property owners certified mail receipts or signatures of all interested parties on a form provided by the commission shall be considered evidence that notice has been given personal appearance at the hearing also shall constitute evidence of notice article xii  conduct of public hearings introduction of a public hearing at the opening of any public hearing of the commission the president of the commission shall state for the permanent record those reasons why the public hearing is being held the president may read the petition to the commission into the permanent record as an introduction presentation of the petitioner at a public hearing before the commission the petitioner property owner or agent for the petitioner or property owner shall present the facts and arguments in support for the case comments and questions from the commission members may be interjected during the presentation for clarification of the subject matter public discussion after a commission question period the president shall begin the public discussion portion of the public hearing by reading all written comments on the petition received by the commission into the permanent record the president shall then open the floor to any person wishing to comment on the petition individuals must address the president and be recognized before speaking each person must state his or her name and address for inclusion in the permanent record the president may limit a speakers time to assure an opportunity for all speakers to comment on the petition public hearing closing the president shall close the public hearing after the commission has adequately heard all interested persons and given the petitioner time to rebut any comments by the commission and interested parties public hearing decision once the public hearing is closed by the president the commission shall consider the petition the commission may either render a decision at the conclusion of the public hearing or may table the decision as under advisement for discussion at the next regularly scheduled meeting of the commission as old business public hearings continuation the commission at its discretion may continue or postpone the hearings of any case on an affirmative vote of a majority of the commission the commission may continue the hearing when in its judgment the petitioner has not provided sufficient evidence on which to make a determination public hearing order every person appearing before the commission shall abide by the order and directions of the president discourteous disorderly or contemptuous conduct shall be regarded as a breach of the privileges of the commission and shall be dealt with as the commission directs article xiii  commission committees committee establishment the president with the approval of the commission may establish such committees as deemed to be necessary and desirable to administer the duties of the commission the purpose terms and number of members on the committee shall be specified at the time of their establishment executive committee in accordance with ic  3674408 the commission may establish an executive committee of not less than three 3 members nor more than nine 9 persons appointed by the commission from its membership the establishment of the executive committee the naming of its individual members and the adoption of rules governing its operation requires a twothirds 23 vote of the entire membership of the commission a majority of the executive committee may act in the name of the commission  but if there are any dissenting votes a person voting in the minority may appeal the decision of the executive committee to the entire commission membership citizen advisory committee in accordance with ic  367+407 the commission may establish advisory committees of citizens interested in problems of planning and zoning in its resolution establishing such a committee the commission shall specify the terms of its members and its purposes each advisory committee of citizens shall 1 study the subject and problems specified by the commission and recommend additional problems in need of study  2 advise the commission concerning how the subject and problems relate particularly to different areas and groups of the city  and 3 if invited by the commission to do so sit with and participate without the right to vote in the deliberations of the commission when subjects of mutual concern are discussed the advisory committee of citizens shall report only to the commission and shall make inquiries and reports only on the subject and problems specified by the commission resolution establishing the committee committee appointing authority the president of the commission shall be the appointing authority for all committees all appointments shall be approved by a vote of the full commission plat committee in accordance with ic  3674701 the plan commission may appoint a plat committee to hold hearings on and approve plats and replats on behalf of the commission the plat committee consists of three 3 persons with at least one 1 of the members being a member of the commission each appointment of a member of the plat committee is for a term of one 1 year but the commission may remove a member from the committee the commission must mail notice of the removal to the member at their residence address a member who is removed may not appeal the removal to a court or otherwise the plat committee may take action only by a majority vote the plat committee may grant primary approval to minor subdivision plats that subdivide four 4 or lots without public notice or hearing and subject to appeal to the plan commission the plat committee may also grant secondary approval to minor subdivision plats or other secondary plats that are submitted to the zoning administrator within ten 10 days after primary approval the zoning administrator shall provide for due notice to interested parties to their right to appeal to the plan commission the notice shall be given in the manner set forth in ic  36747062 and 7063 article xiv  plat and plan requirements primary plat or preliminary plan 1 the plat shall be drawn at a scale of one hundred 100 feet to one 1 inch sheets shall not exceed twentyfour 24 inches by thirtysix 36 inches in size other scales andor sheet sizes are permitted if prior approval is granted by the commission 2 the plat shall include a vicinity map showing the following 3 location of proposed subdivision 4 existing subdivisions and parcels of land adjacent to the proposed subdivision including the names of the property owners 5 existing schools parks playgrounds or other similar public facilities that will serve the proposed subdivision 6 all public thoroughfaresrightsofway adjacent to the site 7 location and size of all utilities adjacent to the subdivision site including sanitary and storm sewers gas lines electric lines telephone lines water mains fire hydrants cable television lines etc 8 existing zoning of the tract and all contiguous tracts surrounding the proposed subdivision 9 all section and by notation on available maps of an appropriate scale 12 two copies of a primary subdivision plat shall be submitted showing the following 13 the proposed name of the subdivision 14 names and datum plane 18 layout of lots showing dimensions and numbers 19 building lines showing setback dimensions throughout the subdivision 20 parcels of land proposed to be dedicated or reserved for schools parks playgrounds or other public semipublic or community purposes 21 existing and proposed streets and rightsofway on and adjoining the site of the proposed subdivision showing the proposed names roadway widths types and widths of pavements curbs sidewalks bikeways jogging paths and other recreational ways this may be deferred to the secondary plat approval stage if permitted by the zoning administrator 22 existing and proposed easements including the location width and purpose of each easement 23 location and size of utilities existing and proposed on the site including storm and storm water drainage system to an improved outlet data shall be included showing that said outlet is adequate to accommodate the drainage requirements of the finished development the plan shall location of water courses marshes wetlands wooded areas isolated trees to be preserved houses barns and other structures and significant features 27 proposed sidewalks 28 proposed decorative lighting  official seal official seal the commission shall adopt a seal with the caption the seal of the whiting plan commission the secretary shall employ the seal to certify to all official acts of the commission article xv  amendments amendments administrative rules and procedures amendments may be proposed by any member of the commission the commission may amend these administrative rules and procedures by a majority vote of the membership at a regular or special meeting of the commission refinement amendments to these administrative rules and procedures are to be typed and distributed to all commission members prior to a vote at a regular or special meeting of the commission a proposed amendment may be refined at the meeting only by deletion and minor refinement enactment these administrative rules and procedure shall be in full force and effect from and after its passage and approval by the commission administrative rules and procedures review the commission shall review the administrative rules and procedures prior to january 31 of each new calendar year or at the first meeting of each calendar year all new sections major rewording of sections or similar potentially significant changes to the administrative rules and procedures may only be approved after a complete review of the commissions administrative rules and procedures at that time upon a comprehensive review of the administrative rules and procedures the commission shall vote upon and adopt any and all subsequent changes to the administrative rules and procedures newly adopted administrative rules and procedures shall be dated and filed in the whiting clerktreasurers office and made part of the public record article xvi  repeal repeal of previous rules all previous administrative rules and procedures heretofore adopted by the whiting plan commission are hereby expressly repealed as of the effective date of these administrative rules and procedures article xvii  adoption adoption the administrative rules and procedures of the whiting plan commission of the city of whiting lake county indiana were approved by the vote of yea nay abstentions members present at the regular meeting of the commission held on the day of steve spebar president attest rebeca unate secretary attest mark adam clerktreasurer board of zoning appeals rules and procedures introduction like many planning and zoning commissions a board of zoning appeals can improve with the establishment of and utilization of a good set of administrative rules thorough and wellthought administrative rules set forth the organizational aspects of the board and establish a definite procedure for conducting board business the administrative rules should include sections on officers and employees meetings order of business committees and public hearings in addition to being required by the planning statutes of the state administrative rules are essential because each board member should be aware without question of how the board conducts business and operates furthermore land developers community officials and the general public should be able to determine at any time how the board conducts its business and operates as a final note if a set of rules and procedures are adopted the board must follow them if the board disregards the adopted rules and procedures the board may be opening itself to serious legal problems if a petitioner appeals its decision however if the board opts not to establish or adopt a set of rules and procedures certain minimum standards of administrative procedure will be implied the following administrative rules and procedures for the whiting board of zoning appeals are documented in article form with the individual articles further divided into sections upon adoption by the whiting board of zoning appeals these administrative rules and procedures will become the official set of rules and procedures governing the boards operation and business and all whiting board of zoning appeals meetings hearings and official actions all references to the state local planning legislation of the indiana coded with an ic and all references to the whiting municipal coded with wmc article i  legislation of establishment establishment a the whiting board of zoning appeals hereinafter known as the bza or the board is established by ic  3674901a which states as part of the zoning ordinance the legislative body shall establish a board of zoning appeals b according to the whiting municipal the whiting bza is established with membership and appointments provided in accordance with to 69 inclusive of of the acts of the indiana general assembly of 1947 and all acts now or hereafter amendatory thereto known as ic  3674900 inclusive c the board of zoning appeals is composed of one 1 division unless the zoning ordinance is amended under ic  3674901b whenever it is considered desirable the zoning ordinance in accordance with 367490hb may be amended to establish an additional one 1 two 2 or three 3 divisions of the board of zoning appeals d after  whenever any divisions of the board of zoning appeals are established or reestablished by the zoning ordinance the ordinance must provide for each division to consist of five 5 members appointed in accordance with section 902 ic  3674902 of the 900 series board of zoning appeals e the zoning ordinance may provide that any additional division of the board of zoning appeals having been established under ic  3674901b is to have only limited territorial jurisdiction the zoning ordinance must describe the limits of that divisions territorial jurisdiction and specify whether that division has exclusive or concurrent jurisdiction within that territory f according to ic  3674901d the board shall be known as an advisory board of zoning appeals under the advisory planning law g according to ic  3674901h any board of zoning appeals that was established under ic  187311 repealed continues as the board of zoning appeals for that jurisdiction until otherwise provided by the zoning ordinance h according to ic  3674917 the fiscal body of the municipality the whiting common council may appropriate under ic  3674308 such amounts as are necessary to carry out the duties of the board article ii  board authority and duties authority a in accordance with ic  3674916 the board shall adopt rules which may not conflict with the zoning ordinance concerning 1 the filing of appeals  2 the application for variances special exceptions special uses contingent uses and conditional uses  3 the giving of notice  the conduct of hearings  and 4 the determination of whether a variance application is for a variance of use or for a variance from development standards such as height bulk or area b the board may also adopt rules providing for 1 the allocation of cases filed among the divisions if any of the board  and 2 the fixing of dates for hearing by the divisions  c rules adopted by the board shall be printed and be made available to all applicants and other interested parties in addition according to wmc  subsection c the board of zoning appeals shall adopt rules and regulations as it may deem necessary to effectuate the provisions of the wmc title of board of zoning appeals and the ie 900 series board of zoning appeals powers and duties the bza shall have all the powers and duties as documented in the 900 series board of zoning appeals of the indiana addition according to the whiting municipal titled powers and duties the bza shall have the powers and perform the duties as provided in sections  the whiting municipal sections include for an administrative review section  the granting of special exceptions section  and the granting of variances section  article iii  board membership membership in accordance with ic  3674902a each advisory board of zoning appeals shall consist of five 5 members the whiting bza membership shall be appointed as members of the whiting plan commission  2 one 1 citizen member shall be appointed by the fiscal body of the municipality the mayor of whiting and the whiting common council who must not be a member of the whiting plan commission  and 3 one 1 citizen member appointed by the advisory plan commission the whiting plan commission who must be a member of the whiting plan commission other than the member appointed by the executive of the municipality the mayor of whiting division membership in accordance with ic  3674902g whenever the zoning ordinance provides for a certain division of the board of zoning appeals to have limited territorial jurisdiction it must also provide for that division to consist of member who are all residents of that limited territory those members shall be appointed in the same manner that is prescribed by ic  3674902a for divisions of an advisory board of zoning appeals but if the whiting plan commission is unable to make its appointment in that manner the appointment shall be made instead by the legislative body the mayor of whiting and the whiting common council restriction on holding office in accordance with ic  3674905 no members of the board of zoning appeals may hold other elective or appointed office except as permitted by ic  3674902 of this  in municipal county or state government in addition a member must be resident of the jurisdictional area of the board of zoning appeals membership terms in accordance with ic  3674906 in an advisory board of zoning appeals when an initial term of office expires each new appointment is for a term of four 4 years a upon the establishment of a board of zoning appeals and or any divisions the members shall initially be appointed as provided in the zoning ordinance for the following terms of office 1 one 1 for a term of one 1 year  2 one 1 for a term of two 2 years  3 one 1 for a term of three 3 years  and 4 two 2 for a term of four 4 years each b in accordance with ic  3674906c each members appointed term expires on the first monday of january of the first second third or fourth year respectively after the year of the members respective appointment c in accordance with ic  3674906g a member of the board of zoning appeals serves until his successor is appointed and qualified a member is eligible for reappointment at the conclusion of his or her board term removal of a member in accordance with ic  36749060 the appointing authority may remove a member from the board for due cause the appointing authority must mail notice of the removal along with the written reasons for the removal to the member at the members current residential address a member who is removed may within thirty 30 days after receiving notice of the removal appeal the removal to the circuit or superior court of the county vacancy in accordance with ic  3674907a if a vacancy occurs among the members of the board of zoning appeals the appointing authority shall appoint a member for the unexpired term of the vacating member in addition the appointing authority may appoint an alternate member to participate with the board in any hearing or decision in which the regular member it has appointed has a disqualification conflict of interest under ic  3674909 article iv  board members election in accordance with ic  3674912 and wmc the first meeting of each calendar year the board shall elect a chairperson and a vicechairperson from its membership the vicechairperson may act as chairperson during the absence or disability of the chairperson duties of the chairperson the chairperson of the board shall preside over meetings decide the order subject to appeal by board members and preserve decorum in the meeting room the chairperson shall pronounce the decisions of the board for purposes of recording in the minutes resignation or replacement of officers upon resignation or replacement of the chairperson or vicechairperson as a member of the board of zoning appeals the board shall elect a successor at its next scheduled meeting board appointments and employees in accordance with ic  3674913 and wmc the board of zoning appeals may appoint and fix the compensation of a secretary and such employees as are necessary for the discharge of its duties all in conformity to and compliance with salaries and compensations thereto fixed by the whiting common council duties of the secretary the secretary shall keep the minutes of all the board of zoning appeals meetings the secretary shall record the minutes each meetings and hearings proceedings and record each members vote in addition the secretary shall conduct all of the boards correspondence as necessary representative to the common council one member of the board shall be designated as the boards representative to the whiting common council the boards representative shall speak for the board at all whiting common council meetings and answer any and all questions in regard to the whiting bza whiting plan commission shall provide for suitable facilities for the holding of board meetings and hearings in addition the whiting plan commission shall provide the board with suitable facilities for preserving the boards records documents and accounts meeting or hearing place the board of zoning appeals meeting or hearings will take place at whiting city hall located at 1443119th street the meetings or hearings will be held in the whiting conference room located on the second floor of whiting city hall unless otherwise posted on the doors of city hall in accordance with ic 1514155 meetings and hearings a meeting and hearings of the board of zoning appeals shall be fixed and scheduled by the board itself the board shall fix the time and date of a meeting or hearing upon request by the whiting plan commission to hear administrative appeals exceptions uses and variance petitions from a land or property owner b in accordance with wmc  subsection e all meetings and hearings of the board shall be open to the public the board shall keep minutes of its proceedings keep records of its examinations and other official actions and shall record the vote on all actions taken all minutes and records shall be titled in the office of the board whiting clerk treasurers office and shall be made part of the public record notice of meetings a public notice in accordance with ic 15312b states that if the event is a public hearing or meeting notice shall be published one 1 time at least ten 10 days before the date of the hearing or meeting b ic  514155 states that public notice of the date time and place of any meetings executive sessions or of any rescheduled or reconvened meeting shall be given at least fortyeight 48 hours before the meeting public notice shall be given by the governing body of a public agency by 1 posting a copy of the notice at the principal office of the public agency holding the meeting or if no such office exists at the building where the meeting is to be held  and 2 depositing in the united states mail with postage prepaid or by delivering notice to all news media which file by january 1 an annual written request for such notices with the city of whiting c this requirement does not apply to reconvened meetings where announcement of the date time and place of the reconvened meetings is made at the original meeting and recorded in a memoranda and minutes thereof and there is no change in the agenda emergency meetings ic  514155 also states that if a meeting is called to deal with an emergency involving actual or threatening injury to person or property or actual or threatening disruption of the governmental activity under the jurisdiction of the commission by any event then the time requirements of notice under ic  514155 shall not apply but 1 news media which have requested notice of meetings must be given the same notice as is given to the members of the commission  2 the public must be notified by posting a copy of the notice according to ic  514155 notice of hearings in accordance with ic  3674920 the board of zoning appeals shall fix a reasonable time for the hearing of administrative appeals exceptions uses and variances a public notice in accordance with ic  5312b states that if the event is a public hearing or meeting notice shall be published one 1 time at least ten 10 days before the date of the hearing or meeting in addition wmc 2 states notice of such hearing shall be posted on in or at the following locations 1 the property for which special exception is sought  2 whiting city hall  and 3 a newspaper of general circulation in the locality ten 10 days prior to the public hearing b in accordance with ic  5312h in case any officer charged with the duty of publishing any notice required by law is unable to procure advertisement at the price fixed by law or the newspaper refuses to publish the advertisement it is sufficient for the officer to post printed notices in three 3 prominent places in the political subdivision in lieu of such advertisement in newspapers c in accordance with ic  5314 and due notice to interested parties notice shall be given at least ten 10 days before the date set for the hearing d in accordance with wmc  subsection 2 the owner of the property for which special exemption is sought or his agent shall be notified by mail of the date and time of such hearing e the party making an appeal or applying for the exception use or variance may be required to assume the cost of public notice and due notice to interested parties at the hearing each party may appear in person by agent or attorney f the board shall by rule determine who the interested parties are how notice is to be given to them and who is required to give that notice g 2 states the cost of advertising the notices of public hearing shall be borne by the petitioner hearing appearances a in accordance with wmc  subsection 3 if a public hearing is held any party may appear in person or by agent or attorney b in accordance with ic  3674920e the staff as defined in the zoning ordinance if any may appear before the board at the hearing and present evidence in support of or in opposition to the granting of a variance or the determination of any other matter c in accordance with ic  36749201 other persons may appear and present relevant evidence d in accordance with ic  3674920g a person may not communicate with any member of the board of zoning appeals before the hearing with the intent to influence the members action on a matter pending before the board not less than five 5 days before the hearing however the staff as defined in the zoning ordinance if any may file with the board a written statement setting forth any facts or opinions relating to the matter e in accordance with ic  3674920h the board may require any party adverse to any pending petition to enter a written appearance specifying the partys name and address if the written appearance is entered more than four 4 days before the hearing the board may also require the petitioner to furnish each adverse party with a copy of the petition and a plot plan of the property involved f no one who is not a member of the board shall be permitted to address the board during a hearing except by request and consent of the chairperson or of the vicechairperson acting as the chairperson in his or her absence article vii  minutes and records meeting minutes in accordance with ic  3674915 and wmc e the board of zoning appeals shall keep minutes of its proceedings and record the vote on all actions taken the board shall in all cases heard make written findings of fact of its decision all minutes and records shall be filed in the office of the board the whiting clerktreasurers office and are to be made part of the public records minutes the secretary of the board of zoning appeals shall prepare and maintain the minutes and proceedings of all board meetings and hearings the minutes shall include the vote of each board member on each question decision appeal or variance presented to the board in order to document that the board member is absent abstaining with permission or not voting because of a disqualification minute approval the minutes of each meeting or hearing shall be presented to the board for approval at a special meeting set to approve such minutes when approved the minutes of the boards meeting or hearing shall be signed by the chairperson or the chairperson acting as the chairperson and attested by the secretary minute filing upon the boards approval of a meeting or hearing minutes the secretary shall file the approved minutes and all other records in the office of the board as public record if no such office exists the minutes shall be filed with the whiting clerktreasurers office and made a part of the public record minute inspection in accordance with ic  51433 any person may inspect and copy the minutes andor anypublic records of the board during regular business hours of the whiting clerktreasurers office except as provided in ic  151434 article viii  official action of the board official action in accordance with ic  3674911 action of the board is not official unless it is authorized by a majority of the entire membership of the board quorum in accordance with ic  3674910 and wmc  subsection d a quorum consists of a majority of the entire membership of the board conflict of interest in accordance with ic  3674909 a board member may not participate in a hearing or decision concerning a zoning matter in which such board member has a direct or indirect financial interest the board shall enter into its record 1 the fact that a regular member has such a disqualification  and 2 the name of the alternate member if any who participates in the hearing or decision in place of the regular member roll call vote all decisions of the board shall be decided by a roll call vote of the board voting of the board shall be by roll call vote of each board member all members present shall vote on every decision made by the board unless they are permitted to abstain by the presiding officer or in the case of a zoning matter have disqualified themselves because of a conflict of interest as defined under of this   tabling decisions in the event a majority vote of the board cannot be achieved due to absences permitted abstentions or disqualifications the matter before the board meeting or hearing shall be rescheduled or reconvened within a reasonable time period meeting at the request of any board member a petitioner or a remonstrator decision appeal by a member any member of the board who voted with the majority may call for a reconsideration of any vote at the same meeting of the board at which an official decision was passed and if sustained by a majority of the board members the reconsideration shall be ordered order of business for a board meeting the order of business at board meetings shall be 1 call to order  2 roll call  3 determination of quorum  4 consideration of minutes of previous meeting  5 communications bills and expenditures  6 report of the chairperson  7 old business  8 new business  9 public discussion  and 10 adjournment order of business for a board hearing the order of business for a board hearing shall be 1 call to order  2 roll call  3 determination of quorum  4 introduction of case to board members  5 petitioners case  6 question period by board  7 comments from organized groups committees or individuals  8 petitioners rebuttal  9 close hearing  10 board discussion  11 final decision and finding by board  12 board members appeal  13 if moved return to board discussion of the hearing agenda  and 14 adjournment article ix  board appeals jurisdiction in accordance with ic  36749181 and wmc  the board shall hear and determine appeals from and review 1 any order requirement decision or determination made by an administrative official hearing officer or staff member under the zoning ordinance  2 any order requirement decision or determination made by an administrative board or other body except the plan commission in relation to the enforcement of the zoning ordinance  or 3 any order requirement decision or determination made by an administrative board or other body except the plan commission in relation to the enforcement of an ordinance adopted under the 900 series board of zoning appeals requiring the procurement of an improvement location or occupancy permit procedure a in accordance with 3674919 subsection a an appeal to the board must specify the grounds of the appeal and must be filed within such time and in such form as may be prescribed by the board by rule b in accordance with wmc  subsection a any decision of an administrative official in the enforcement of the title may be appealed to the board by any person claiming to be adversely affected by such decision and in accordance with ic  3674919a and wmc  subsection a the administrative official hearing officer administrative board or other body shall on request of the board transmit to it all documents plans and papers constituting the record of the action form which an appeal was taken in addition according to ic  3674919c certified copies of the documents plans and papers constituting the record may be transmitted for the purposes of ic  3674919b c in accordance with wmc  subsection b the board shall fix a reasonable time for the hearing of an appeal give due notice thereof to the parties of interest and decide the same within a reasonable time in any case within sixty 60 days d in accordance with ic  3674919d and wmc  subsection a upon appeal the board may reverse affirm wholly or modify the order requirement decision or determination appealed from and may make such order requirement decision or determination as ought to be made for this purpose the board has all the powers of the official officer board or body from which the appeal was taken article x  variances variances from use in accordance with ic  36749184 and wmc  the board shall approve or deny variances of use from the terms of the zoning ordinance the board may impose reasonable conditions as part of its approval a variance may impose reasonable conditions as part of its approval a variance may be approved under this section only upon a determination in writing that 1 the approval will not be injurious to the public health safety morals and general welfare of the community  2 the use and value of the area adjacent to the property included in the variance will not be affected in a substantially adverse manner  3 the need for the variance arises from some condition peculiar to the property involved specifically the land structure or building involved and which are not applicable to other lands structures or buildings in the same district  4 the strict application of the terms of the zoning ordinance if applied to the property for which the variance is sought will constitute an unnecessary hardship and will deprive the applicant of rights commonly enjoyed by other properties in the same district 5 that the special conditions and circumstances do not result from the actions of the applicant  6 that granting the variance requested will not confer on the applicant any special privilege that is denied by this title to other lands structures or buildings in the same district  and 7 the approval does not interfere substantially with the official comprehensive plan for the city of whiting adopted under the 500 series comprehensive plan of the indiana   variances from development standards in accordance with ic  36749185 and wmc  the board shall approve or deny variances from the development standards such as height bulk or area of the zoning ordinance a variance may be approved under this section only upon a determination in writing that 1 the approval will not be injurious to the public health safety morals and general welfare of the community  2 the use and value of the area adjacent to the property included in the variance will not be affected in a substantially adverse manner  3 the need for the variance arises from some condition peculiar to the property involved specifically the land structure or building involved and which are not applicable to other lands structures or buildings in the same district  4 the strict application of the terms of the zoning ordinance will result in practical difficulties in the use of the property however the zoning ordinance may establish a stricter standard than the practical difficulties standard prescribed by this subdivision 5 that the special conditions and circumstances do not result from the actions of the applicant  6 that granting the variance requested will not confer on the applicant any special privilege that is denied by this title to other lands structures or buildings in the same district  and 7 the approval does not interfere substantially with the official comprehensive plan for the city of whiting adopted under the 500 series comprehensive plan of the indiana   granting variances a in accordance with wmc  the board shall authorize upon appeal in specific cases such variance from the terms of the wmc title as will not be contrary to the public interest where owing to special conditions a literal enforcement of the provisions of the title would result in unnecessary hardship and so that the spirit of the title shall be observed and substantial justice done no such variances shall be granted by the board unless and until 1 a written application for a variance is submitted indicating the section or sections of the zoning ordinance and title or titles under which the variance is sought and stating the grounds in which the variance is requested  2 notice of such hearing shall be given in accordance with titled notice of hearings of these administrative rules and procedures  3 a public hearing shall be held at which any party may appear in person by agent or by attorney  4 the board shall make a finding or findings that the requirements of sections 1 and 2 of this been met 5 the board shall further make finding that a granting the variance is necessary for the reasonable use of the land or building and that the variance as granted by the board is the minimum variance that will accomplish the relief sought by the applicant  and b granting the variance will be in harmony with the general purpose and intent of this title and will not be injurious to the neighborhood or otherwise detrimental to the public welfare b no nonconforming use of neighboring lands structures or buildings in the same district and no permitted use of lands structures or buildings in other districts shall be considered grounds for the issuance of a variance c under no circumstances shall the board grant a variance to allow a use not permissible under the terms of this title in the district involved or any use expressly or by implication prohibited by the terms of this title in said district d in granting any variance the board may prescribe appropriate conditions and safeguards in conformity with this title violations of such conditions and safeguards when made a part of the terms under which the variance is granted shall deem a violation of this title article xi  special exceptions and uses exceptions and uses in accordance with ic  36749182 a board shall approve or deny all 1 special exceptions as defined  2 special uses as defined  3 contingent uses as defined  and 4 conditional uses as defined  from the terms of the zoning ordinance but only in the classes of cases or in the particular situations specified in the zoning ordinance the board may impose reasonable conditions as a part or its approval granting special exceptions and uses a in accordance with wmc  subsection a the board shall hear and decide special exceptions to the terms of this title upon which the board is required to act under this title permit and authorize exceptions to the district regulations only in the classes of cases or in particular situations as specified in the title a special exception shall not be granted by the board unless and until 1 a written application for a special exception is submitted indicating the section of the zoning ordinance and title under which the special exception is sought and stating the grounds in which it is requested  2 notice of such hearing shall be given in accordance with titled notice of hearings of these administrative rules and procedures  3 a public hearing shall be held at which any party may appear in person by agent or by attorney 4 the board shall make a finding that it is empowered under this title to grant the special exception and that the granting will not adversely affect the public interest b in accordance with wmc  subsection b in granting any special exception the board may prescribe appropriate conditions and safeguards in conformity with the zoning ordinance violation of such conditions and safeguards when made part of the terms under which the special exception is granted shall be deemed a violation of the zoning ordinance the board shall prescribe a time limit within the action for which the special exception is required shall be begun completed or both failure to begin or complete of both such actions within the time limit set shall void the special exception article xii  exception use or variance commitment by owner commitment by owner a in accordance with ic  3674921 in case of a petition for a special exception special use contingent use conditional use or variance form the terms of the zoning ordinance the board may permit or require the owner of a parcel of property to make a written commitment concerning the use or development of that parcel b the board may 1 adopt rules governing the creation form recording modification enforcement and termination of commitments  and 2 adopt rules designating which specially affected persons and classes of specially affected persons are entitled to enforce commitments c commitments shall be recorded in the office of the county recorder and take effect upon the granting of the exception use or variance unless modified or terminated by the board a commitment is binding on the owner of the parcel each subsequent owner and each other person acquiring an interest in the parcel a commitment is binding on the owner of the parcel even if it is unrecorded  however an unrecorded commitment is binding on subsequent owner or other persons acquiring an interest in the parcel only if that subsequent owner or other person has actual notice of the commitment a commitment may be modified or terminated only by a decision of the board made at a public hearing after notice as provided by rule d by permitting or requiring commitments a board does not obligate itself to approve or deny any request e conditions imposed on the granting of an exception use or variance are not subject to the rules applicable to commitments f this section does not affect the validity of any covenant easement equitable servitude or other land use restriction created in accordance with law article xiii  alternate procedure reserved this reserved for the establishment of an alternate procedure by the plan commission if the board deems necessary under which there can be a more expedient disposition of matters under a hearing officer ic  3674923 documents the law for alternate procedure and ic  3674924 documents the alternate procedures rules regarding such proceedings article xiv  final approval or denial final decision in accordance with ic  3674919e the board shall make a decision on any matter that it is required to hear under the 900 series board of zoning appeals either at the meeting at which the matter is first presented or at the conclusion of the hearing on that matter if it is continued writ decision in accordance with wmc  subsection b every variation granted or denied by the board shall be accompanied by a written finding of fact based on testimony and evidence and shall specify the reason for granting or denying the variation in addition in accordance with ic  36749190 within five 5 days after making a decision under the 900 series board of zoningappeals the board shall file in the office of the board clerktreasurers office a copy of its decision article xv  review by certiorari review criteria in accordance with ic  36741003 and wmc  each and every decision of the board shall be subject to review by certiorari a writ from a higher court to a lower court requesting a transcript of the proceedings of the case for review each person aggrieved by a decision of the board may present to the circuit court or superior court of the county in which the premises affected are located a verified petition setting forth that the decision is illegal in whole or in part and specify the grounds of the illegality no change of venue from the county in which the premises affected are located may be had in any cause arising under this section petition period in accordance with ic  36741003 subsection a the person shall present the petition to the court within thirty 30 days after the entry of that decision of the board article xvi  amendments creation administrative rules and procedure amendments may be proposed by members of the board notification and adoption the board may amend these administrative rules and procedures by a majority of the quorum of the membership refinement amendments to these administrative rules and procedures are to be typed and distributed to all board members prior to being voted upon at a board meeting the proposed amendment may be refined at the meeting only by deletion and minor refinement enactment the board shall enact all amendments to these administrative rules and procedure as quickly as reasonably possible administrative rules and procedures review the board shall review these administrative rules and procedures prior to january 31 of each new calendar year or at the first meeting of each calendar year all new sections major rewording of sections or similar potentially significant changes to these administrative rules and procedures may only be approved after a complete review of the boards administrative rules and procedures at that time after a comprehensive review of these administrative rules and procedures the board shall vote upon and adopt any and all changes into the administrative rules and procedures at that time the new administrative rules and procedures shall be dated and filed in the whiting clerktreasurers office and made part of the public record code comparative table  1962 code to 1979 code this table provides
